Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether procedural fairness was violated in the refusal of permanent residence application
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Refusal of permanent residence application based on misrepresentation
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Principal Applicant's marriage and property ownership found not credible based on prior findings
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Prior administrative findings, lack of responsive evidence from applicants
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged misrepresentation regarding marriage and property ownership
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicants had prior opportunities to respond but failed to do so adequately
Crimes.Application_Error: None found; decision based on established grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified; officer relied on existing record
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness requires notice of determinative issues and opportunity to respond
Crimes.Application_Factor: Prior adverse findings on genuineness of marriage and truthfulness about assets
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: No breach of procedural fairness found
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Misrepresentation regarding marriage and property ownership
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide evidence to rebut prior findings
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach; applicants had ample opportunity to respond
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Principal Applicant's credibility challenged regarding personal relationships and financial disclosures
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural fairness and sufficiency of evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Notice and opportunity to respond to determinative issues

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose material facts relating to a relevant matter that induces or could induce an error in the administration of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether procedural fairness was violated due to lack of notice on key issues
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Refusal of permanent residence application based on non-disclosure
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Marriage assessed as not genuine; applicant failed to provide clarifying information
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Prior findings, absence of new evidence or clarification
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Failure to disclose material facts about marital status and asset ownership
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicants had prior opportunities to address concerns but did not do so effectively
Crimes.Application_Error: None found; decision consistent with prior assessments
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None noted; decision based on completeness of record
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duty to disclose material facts under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Factor: Prior determination of non-genuine marriage and lack of corrective disclosure
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Alleged denial of procedural fairness in assessment process
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to disclose material facts related to marriage and assets
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of evidence to counter administrative findings
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No violation; sufficient opportunity provided to respond
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubts about authenticity of marriage and transparency about financial matters
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that officer failed to notify of determinative issues
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Notification of adverse allegations and right to respond
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation through omission under s. 40(1)(a) IRPA
